net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.validation

Class FixedRegularExpressionValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.validation.AbstractValidator
      • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.validation.StringValueValidator
        • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.validation.RegularExpressionValidator
          • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.validation.FixedRegularExpressionValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Validator

    public abstract class FixedRegularExpressionValidator
extends RegularExpressionValidator
    Base class for validators that always use the same pattern. The method RegularExpressionValidator.getPattern() must be overridden to provide the pattern. The intent of this class is to enable easy creation of validators that may use a regular expression, but the pattern should not be modified.

    An email address validator is a good example. A regular expression can be used to validate the email address, but should not be changed by a developer.

    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

      • setPatternAsString

        public void setPatternAsString(String pattern)
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException. Set the regular expression pattern using a String. The Pattern.compile(java.lang.String) method is used to compile the pattern.
        Overrides:
        setPatternAsString in class RegularExpressionValidator
        Parameters:
